text: Why did the contractor bring a ladder to the meeting? To take the discussion to the next level.
Estimators don’t age — they just adjust their rates.
Safety first, coffee second, deadlines third.
If duct tape can’t fix it, try more duct tape.
Client: ‘Can you finish early?’ Contractor: ‘Sure, if you pay early.’

Why did the contractor break up with his level?
Because she just couldn’t stay on the same plane anymore.

Why did the estimator go broke? Because he kept losing his balance sheet.

I told my boss I needed a raise — he said, “You already have one… it’s called ‘expectations.’”

Why do construction workers make great DJs? They know how to drop the base.

Concrete jokes aren’t funny… but they’re solid.

My architect friend has a great plan — it’s just not drawn yet.

Why don’t builders ever play hide and seek? Because good luck hiding a crane.

The drywall said it was bored — I told it to hang in there.

Why did the foreman get promoted? He nailed every opportunity.

That electrician’s humor is shocking — but current.

My plumber’s jokes always leak out before the punchline.

I asked ChatGPT for a joke… it said, “I’m funnier in premium.”

Wi-Fi went down for five minutes — so I talked to my family. Seems they’re nice people.

Why did the computer go to therapy? Too many bytes from its past.

My password is “incorrect,” so when I forget it, the computer reminds me.

The cloud isn’t safe — mine just rained all my photos.

I told my laptop I needed space… now it won’t stop deleting files.

404: Joke not found.

I would tell you a data joke, but it’s still being processed.

My favorite app is “Nap.” It crashes regularly, but I still use it.

The robot didn’t laugh — guess it didn’t have a sense of humor.exe.

I used to play piano by ear — now I use my hands.

I told my friend she was drawing her eyebrows too high. She looked surprised.

I’m on a whiskey diet. I’ve lost three days already.

I told my doctor I broke my arm in two places. He said, “Then stop going to those places.”

I asked my wife what she wanted for dinner — she said, “Something edible.”

I’m not lazy; I’m on energy-saving mode.

I’d give up sarcasm, but that would be a huge loss for humanity.

My wallet is like an onion — opening it makes me cry.

I’m not arguing, I’m just explaining why I’m right.

Common sense is like deodorant. The people who need it most never use it.

I tried to build a joke — but I ran out of material.

The site manager said I had potential — just needed more concrete results.

Rebar jokes are strong, but they tend to bend under pressure.

Steel yourself before hearing this next one.

My favorite building material? Humor — it holds everything together.

The blueprint had a typo — now we’re building a “moose.”

I told the carpenter a joke… he nailed it.

The brick said to the wall, “Together, we stand tall.”

Cement mixers have the best rhythm — they’re always rolling.

If construction workers made movies, they’d all be blockbusters.

Outlook just crashed again — looks like it couldn’t handle my ambition.

I sent a funny email to HR. Still waiting for the reply… and possibly unemployment.

Why did the employee bring string to work? To tie up loose ends.

My boss told me to think outside the box — so I went home.

Mondays are proof that time travel is real — we go from Friday to Monday instantly.

“Teamwork” means doing it all yourself while everyone else “collaborates.”

My desk is a reflection of my mind — cluttered but functional.

I don’t need an inspirational quote. I need coffee.

My email tone? Somewhere between professional and passive-aggressive.

I renamed my Wi-Fi to “JobSearch” so my boss thinks I’m motivated.

Parallel lines have so much in common — it’s a shame they’ll never meet.

I asked my dog what two minus two was. He said nothing.

I told my suitcase there would be no vacation this year — now I’m dealing with emotional baggage.

Why did the scarecrow win an award? He was outstanding in his field.

I know they say money talks — but all mine says is “Goodbye.”

I told my phone it was getting slow — now we’re not on speaking terms.

I’m not short-tempered, I’m just quickly expressive.

I hate it when people use big words just to sound perspicacious.

Why don’t skeletons fight? They don’t have the guts.

Time flies like an arrow. Fruit flies like a banana.

The hammer started a podcast — it’s called “Nailed It.”

I told the screwdriver to loosen up.

The saw quit its job — said it couldn’t handle the pressure.

My tape measure keeps lying — it always stretches the truth.

The drill didn’t get promoted. It just keeps going in circles.

My wrench has attitude — total torque-ative.

You can’t screw up a good plan — unless you’re using a stripped screw.

Tools gossip a lot — mostly behind your back.

The level always keeps things balanced.

When in doubt, duct tape it out.

I told a chemistry joke — no reaction.

I’m friends with 25 letters of the alphabet. I don’t know Y.

The rotation of Earth really makes my day.

I’m reading a book on anti-gravity — it’s impossible to put down.

I used to be addicted to soap, but I’m clean now.

What’s orange and sounds like a parrot? A carrot.

I told my GPS to take me somewhere fun. It drove me to the liquor store.

Did you hear about the claustrophobic astronaut? He just needed a little space.

Never trust atoms — they make up everything.

I asked the librarian if the library had any books on paranoia. She whispered, “They’re right behind you.”

Success is like Wi-Fi — the closer you are to the source, the stronger the connection.

My life is a construction site — still in progress.

Sometimes the hardest work is pretending to look busy.

Every great idea starts with “This might be stupid, but…”

I don’t procrastinate — I’m just giving ideas time to marinate.

Don’t count your problems. Use a calculator.

I’m not clumsy — the floor just hates me.

I like my coffee how I like my mornings — nonexistent.

If you think nobody cares, try missing a deadline.

Patience is what you have when there are too many tabs open.

Why don’t we ever see elephants hiding in trees? Because they’re good at it.

I told my shadow to back off — it’s been following me everywhere.

My mirror and I are not on speaking terms.

If life gives you lemons, sell them. Inflation’s crazy.

I bought a belt that’s a clock — it’s a waist of time.

Why did the tomato blush? It saw the salad dressing.

I accidentally swallowed some Scrabble tiles. My next trip to the bathroom could spell disaster.

I just burned 1,200 calories — I forgot the pizza in the oven.

My friend said he didn’t understand cloning. I told him, “That makes two of us.”

Never trust stairs — they’re always up to something.
